channel.title: Improving BM page on Wikipedia.org
channel.description:
I was wondering that the [url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Mesa_(video_game)']Black Mesa page on Wikipedia[/url], while being already good, isn't updated with the newest events (post-release, I mean).
Since I actually do not have time to do it myself, but I see here a lot of people with more time and dedication than me: would someone kindly update the page? Especially the "Reception" section: some reviews are already out, and even [url='https://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/black-mesa']Metacritic[/url] and [url='https://www.gamerankings.com/pc/683833-black-mesa/index.html']Gamerankings[/url] list Black Mesa. Something like [url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Half-life_2#Critical_reception']this[/url], with also quotations from game journalists. It would be give more "impact" to the mod, IMO.
Just an idea, don't yell at me. :slight_smile:

item.title: Improving BM page on Wikipedia.org
item.dc:creator: Hubicorn
item.description:
Giazzo:

I was wondering that the Black Mesa page on Wikipedia, while being already good, isn’t updated with the newest events (post-release, I mean).

Since I actually do not have time to do it myself, but I see here a lot of people with more time and dedication than me: would someone kindly update the page?
Especially the “Reception” section: some reviews are already out, and even Metacritic and Gamerankings list Black Mesa. Something like this, with also quotations from game journalists. It would be give more “impact” to the mod, IMO.

Just an idea, don’t yell at me.

Upon release of the retail version, I personally want to update the WIKI entry as well. When the time comes (and you’ll know), let’s all gather back here and update it.
